Articles.Content:
Dateline - Kerbal Space Center - Brent Kerman, KASA spokesman, approaches the stage.

Brent: Thank you all for coming today [brent holds up his hand to shield himself from the camera flashes], thank you, please be seated. The Kerbin AeroSpace Agency has an exciting announcement.

Reporter: An exciting announcement about a KASA success?

Brent: Ahem. Thank you for that comment, Klark. As all of you know, science is a long term project, and success can be a slippery term. So, while the long term success of the mission will be determined, well, in the long term, KASA is proud to announce the launch of KICKARUS INTERSTELLAR.

Klark: Interstellar? How did KASA hide such a big project? Who is flying this unknown craft?

Brent: Let me be clear! KASA has hidden nothing! Barmon "Major Tom" Kerman is well known as a KASA krewman!

Reporter: Barmon? As I recall, he was a new krewman, scheduled for the KICKARUS REBOUND 2 refueling mission.

KNN file photo of last fueling mission to REBOUND 1 (which didn't need a numeric suffix at the time).

KNN file photo of REBOUND Duna mission before the Munar "incident".

Brent: Barmon IS a highly trained KASA krewmember. The REBOUND 2 refueling mission was, ummmm, repurposed.

Klark: But the mission schedule was released just last week. When did this "repurposing" happen?

Brent: (mumble mumble).

Klark: Excuse me?

Brent: About the time that Barmon hit the "Stage" key rather than the "Engine Cutoff" key!

Klark: And that is significant because?

Brent[looking down]: Because, at that point, Barmon had no control over the booster originally intended to top off REBOUND 2' fuel supply.

Klark: So Barmon's current mission is not sanctioned by KASA?

Brent: KASA has always encouraged, ummm, initiative.

Klark: So KASA encourages the hijacking of their craft?

Brent: Of course not! We have no reason to believe Barmon's actions were intentional!

Klark: So Barmon is incompetent?

Brent: KASA has taken no position on that question! All we need is a craft with some 10,000 m/s delta V... just a little more funding will help us resolve this issue, investigate the Barmon incident, and help us educate the Kerban public on the importance of random interstellar rocket launches. Thank you all for your attention. This concludes the briefing.
Hmmm... What was the cause? Reminds me of what happened to my first space station.

"What was the cause?" As described, I (ummm, Barmon) hit the space key, rather than the X key. I had a booster full of fuel, with no control, pushing me at 3-5 g until fuel ran out. At that thrust, I couldn't tumble myself off the out of control booster. When fuel ran out, I was moving at some 5000 m/s.
Hope he has plenty of snacks...
